oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Key market drivers in the organic sector
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Henchion, Maeve
McIntyre, Bridin
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Markets and trade
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The total organic market is valued at more than €100 million. The fresh and chilled category accounts for the majority of this (€77.3m), followed by ambient (€22.6) with a very small amount accounted for by the frozen category(€0.7m). Whilst the sector has grown by 82% in the last 2 years (Bord Bia, 2008), there are signs of a slow down in growth. This paper looks at what is going well from a marketing perspective,identifies some areas requiring attention and suggests a change in positioning to maintain current levels of growth.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Henchion, Maeve and McIntyre, Bridin (2008) Key market drivers in the organic sector. In: Teagasc Organic Research Conference Proceedings, Teagasc, Ireland, pp. 111-113.
